result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian J Hejda

records.addlTxt:
Pre-Trial Conference Data Sheet /s/ MDZ 10/25/22 in re:  request for warrant with a $750 cash alternative GRANTED
Reason:  Defendant failed to appear or contact his attorney for the 10/24 PTC. He is also in warrant status in Waupaca County Case 22CF136. Based on his non-appearance the state would ask for a warrant with a $750 CA.
ptc sheet requesting warrant with cash alternative.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 10/24/22 - not deliverable as addressed
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Assignment of Judge to Zell - no mail receptacle
Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
matter scheduled for ptc 7/18/22 at 10:00

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:13 PM Defendant Brian J Hejda appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.   Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Brian J Hejda. 

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear telephonically and confirms that he can hear and see the parties in the courtroom.
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
Defendant indicates he understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily consenting to use of telephonic conferencing. 

3:15 p.m.  Deputy Sadlemeyer is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Dodge.
3:16 p.m. Witness identifies the defendant.
3:17 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Soule.
ADA Dodge objects, overruled.
Witness is excused.
3:18 p.m.  ADA Dodge has no redirect or any argument.
Atty Soule has no witnesses and no argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: **DUPLICATE**

ADDRESS INFO for Brian J Hejda
Current: 1692 Park View Way, Waupaca, WI 54981 United States  (Effective: 03-02-2022)
Prior: 4300 Sherman Rd, Stevens Point, WI 54985
Preliminary Hearing set or 05/23/22 - no mail receptacle
Warrant Paperwork Returned from the Sheriff's Dept.

1:13 PM Defendant Brian J Hejda appeared by video, Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Brian J Hejda. 

Court calls case.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

Matter is set for a return on a warrant, failure to appear on an initial appearance.
Court reviews the file.
Court questions Atty Soule.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Defense waives time limits for preliminary examination.

State recommends the bond be reinstated.
Defense has no objection.

BY THE COURT:
Signature bond is reinstated as it was ordered on March 1, 2022.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant is quashed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian J Hejda not in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Brian J Hejda. 

Atty Bergner states he is here on behalf of Atty Taylor Soule and he is not aware of where the defendant is. 
Atty Mutchler requests a warrant with a $750 cash alternative. 
Court reviews the file. 

BY THE COURT:  Warrant with a $500 cash alternative.
filed by Atty Taylor Soule
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Taylor Soule
Initial Appearance set for April 4, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 2

Debtor Brian J Hejda appeared by video, Attorney Taylor O Soule appeared in court for Brian J Hejda, Attorney Kelly A Cassidy appeared in court for State of Wis. 
Court Reporter is Lyssa Kaupie.

1:07 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

ADA  Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of possession of meth as a repeater and bailjumping.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation. 

State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty  Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
